page.title: 15Sheepwash Farm Slitting Mill
page.content: Sheepwash Farm is in the village of Slitting Mill. It is mostly grassland except for one field of barley. There are 36 {milking cows,} and 30 other cattle aged from two weeks to two years old. The herd is specially tested. The milk is delivered by the farmer and his wife because the milk does not go to a dairy. It is untreated milk which means it is not pasteurised. They have got about 250 customers. The cows give about 120 gallons per day. The farm is 90 acres, 10 acres of which are rented from another farmer. 45 years ago the farm was owned by the Marquis of Anglesey.
